Business Development Manager - Westpac Bank, Melbourne

Company Name Westpac Group Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 101 views

Be an early applicant

Job description



Westpac Group has a rich heritage and offers employees a multitude of opportunities. We aim to attract the best people inside and outside of the business – building an organisation where the best talent thrives. As we enter into our third century of business, we are cementing ourselves as one of the leading financial services company in Australia. We’re turning banking upside down by building strong teams at a local level, led by Managers who are close to their customers and empowered to make decisions that make sense for people in the communities they serve.

The Role

Reporting to the State Manager Home Lending, the Business Development Manager is a key business generation specialist driving First Party Home Lending through the Referrer Channel. He/She is accountable for generating new Referral Partners and for managing and growing a portfolio of existing referral partners. He/She will be providing coaching and supporting Mobile Home Finance Managers, Lending Area Managers, Relationship Directors and Relationship Managers across the Westpac Retail & Premium Network.

The Business Development Manager will be regarded as a retail banking expert in their assigned market and will be known as a trusted advisor to new and existing referral partners. This is a mobile role; therefore the Business Development Manager will have the ability to manage across multiple markets and stakeholders.

Accountabilities

  • Leading the preparation and execution of a referrer business development and sales plan for an assigned market/s
  • Proactively seeking new external opportunities and developing key business referral relationships in the local market
  • Manage and grow a portfolio of existing referral partners
  • Proactive acquisition of customers through working closely with Mobile Home Finance Managers, referral partners and self-initiated business development activities to identify new customer opportunities
  • Developing strong relationships with existing and new referrers, through the provision of superior customer service
  • Present as required at training days, networking and information evenings
  • Responsible for managing risk and compliance for the designated portfolio of referrers
  • Be an active member of the assigned regions enabling identification and building of relationships with retail customers, business influencers and referral partners
  • Partnering with Lending Area Managers and Relationship Directors to understand opportunity areas and insights from local communities
  • Work closely with Mobile Home Finance Managers and branch teams who will fulfil the customers’ needs

    • The person

  • Proven track record in generating new business in a defined business development role
  • 3-5 years of business development experience in the financial sector
  • Exceptional presentation, communication and networking skills
  • Demonstrated ability to engage with B2B partnerships using their value perspective to resolve issues, manage conflict or create opportunities
  • Proven track record in delivering results and meeting customer needs and expectations
  • Demonstrated capability to develop relationships and partnerships
  • Healthy ambition, self-confidence and a strong desire to personally invest in the high performance team culture within Westpac Retail & Premium
  • Sales and Service Practices
  • Coaching skills
  • Superior organisational skills
  • Analysing and interpreting
  • Attention to detail
  • Adapting and responding to change
  • Strong presentation and communication skills
  • Networking skills
  • Influencing and negotiation skills
  • Business acumen and market knowledge

    • Westpac Group is an equal opportunity employer. As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We have market leading employee benefits and financial product discounts. We also wholeheartedly support inclusion in the workplace and believe that work is something that you do and not somewhere you go to.

The Caydon Difference

Caydon have established a strong presence over the past 17 years, ensuring a continual pipeline of projects flow through our development lifecycle. \xa0

Reporting to the Marketing Manager, your primary responsibility will be to contribute to the creation and implementation of marketing programs and campaigns. Job description

After customers purchase our products, you’re the one who helps them get more out of their new Apple technology. Your day in the Apple Store is filled with a range of focused support and service tasks. Whether you’re helping customers get started with the Mac or finding answers to their questions about other Apple devices, you’re ready to share knowledge and provide exceptional assistance. You gain satisfaction from bringing resolution and insight to each customer, elevating his or her relationship with Apple to the next level.

Description

As a Technical Specialist, you help new owners get started and current ones get quick, efficient support — developing strong, positive relationships with Apple. When a customer needs assistance, you quickly assess their situation. Sometimes you take care of customers with advice or a solution on the spot, using your knowledge of current Apple technology to help with iPod, iPhone and iPad devices. At other times, you refer customers to Support team members who get them up and running again. You even provide personal training for new customers, helping them acquire the basic skills they need to get started on photo, video and music projects. The entire store team benefits from your commitment to providing the best care for customers. By helping Apple maintain strong relationships with customers, you are instrumental to our success.

Key Qualifications

Ability to assess customers’ support needs when they arrive, then provide solutions or refer them to other team members
Flexibility to regularly rotate through different technical specialities and skill sets
Ability to thrive on change as products evolve

Additional Requirements
  • You have excellent time management skills and can make decisions quickly.
  • You maintain composure and customer focus while troubleshooting and solving issues.

    • About Infosys Portland

    Infosys Portland partners with our clients to solve their most complex and challenging procurement and supply chain problems. We combine our specialist expertise with consulting rigour, leading technologies and proven services to get things done, deliver sustainable value and guide our clients into the future.

    Due to upcoming demand in our business and career progression, we are looking for individuals to join our team and make a difference for our clients.

    Headquartered in Sydney, Australia, we also have established offices in Melbourne, Brisbane, Perth, Singapore, Chicago and Pune. We work with leading national and global organisations across the full spectrum of industries, in both the public and private sectors. Infosys Portland is the dedicated procurement and supply chain consulting practice within Infosys, a global provider of technology, services and consulting, with US$11 billion in annual revenue and 200,000 employees spread across the world.


    The Role

    As a Manager you will regularly be the prime point of contact for our clients, applying your problem solving skills, stakeholder management skills, analytical skills as well as experience to maximise the competitive advantage our clients derive from their supply base. Finance Business Partner

Company Name Seqirus Company Location Parkville, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 193 views

Job description

Starting a century ago, CSL made a promise to save lives and protect the health of people stricken with a range of serious and chronic medical conditions. Today that same promise has never been stronger. Seqirus, a CSL group company, manufactures and in-licenses, markets and distributes speciality pharmaceuticals and vaccines for the prevention and treatment of serious disease. Most significantly, Seqirus is a major contributor to the prevention and control of influenza globally.

\xa0

If the challenges of tomorrow inspire you more than the achievements of yesterday; If you can push boundaries while promoting proven approaches; If you think great ideas can come from anywhere so everyone's voice should be heard; If you believe a successful company can be profitable and compassionate, Seqirus\xa0is for you!

\xa0

The role is a fixed term, full time position located in Parkville (Australia) and is part of the Operations and Quality Finance team. The Finance Business Partner will provide accounting support, reporting and analysis to Seqirus management, to enable them to make informed business decisions. You will be responsible for the preparation and analysis of monthly inventory reports and complete inventory budgets and forecasts. You will be required to work with the business to ensure cycle counts are performed regularly and liaise with auditors in the event of an enquiry. This role will also present the opportunity to implement process improvements and adjust Seqirus’ inventory and financial reporting method.

\xa0

To be successful in this role you will be Tertiary level qualified in accounting, finance or business related field, possess CPA/CA qualifications and a minimum 5 years of finance experience, specifically management accounting experience and preferably in manufacturing environments. You will possess excellent analytical skills, be proficient in Microsoft Excel and be able to manage multiple deliverables within tight timeframes. As a well rounded finance professional, you are able to build relationships with key stakeholders using highly developed communication and influencing skills.

\xa0

If you are looking to develop your skills and shape the health of Australians, please apply.

\xa0

Applications must address the selection criteria above and include a current CV, covering letter and reference number R-067396


https://csl.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/Seqirus_External/job/APAC-AU-Parkville-Seqirus/Inventory---Reporting-Analyst_R-067939 \xa0

\xa0

CSL advises that screening including; criminal history, medical assessment, confirmation of experience, stated qualifications and other relevant checks form a part of the candidate suitability evaluation process. Where applicable, this applies to current CSL employees. CSL employees must notify their current manager when selected for interview for any advertised internal vacancies.

\xa0

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies\xa0
Seqirus does not accept unsolicited referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact Seqirus' Talent Acquisition to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to Seqirus. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and Seqirus. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of Seqirus. Seqirus shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site

845641242:
[

Occupations Coordinator

Company Name Metro Trains Melbourne Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Metro Tunnel Project | Free Public Transport
  • 3-Year, Full-Time - Maximum-Term Opportunity
  • Parliament Station Location

Are you interested in joining Metro Trains Melbourne’s project team who are involved in multibillion dollar city-shaping infrastructure projects? Can you bring your wealth of Occupations experience to help us support the delivery of the Metro Tunnel Project – Victoria’s biggest rail infrastructure project?

If the answer is "Yes", keep reading!

The Metro Tunnel Project

The Metro Tunnel Project is a game-changer for our city and our customers. The project will deliver more frequent services for customers, reducing network congestion and overcrowding. By introducing new systems and infrastructure it will modernise the network and deliver greater reliability. It will be the catalyst for better connectivity to underpin Melbournes sustainable growth into the future. The Metro Tunnel Project has the capacity to transform Melbourne and we are proud to be partners in its delivery.

About The Role

This is the perfect opportunity to join the Metro Tunnel Project and in particular, our Operations team. As a Occupation Coordinator, you will be tasked with providing specific support and advice to the MTP Package Rail Disruption Managers including attending Occupation coordination meetings, reviewing Project Occupation Coordination Documents and representing the Program team. This will require you to:
  • Co-ordinate with Network Safety and Operations to ensure that all Occupations and their subsequent limits are correctly represented and submitted within MTM’s Access and Resource Management System (ARMS)
  • Support the preparation and development of Draft Protection Plans for endorsement by Network Safety
  • Support the Works Readiness process and ensure that ‘T minus’ Stage Gates are achieved for all Occupations
  • Support and contribute to the preparation and publishing of key Occupation documentation such as Works Guides
  • Support the Rail Disruption Managers to secure the required MTM critical Resources required within each Occupation
  • Attend Planning Meetings associated with both disruptive and non-disruptive Occupations
  • Liaise with other Rail Transport Operators, where Works are proposed at or across jurisdictional boundaries
  • Attend site to evaluate the potential impact of Works and necessary access requirements to facilitate
  • Participate in post-Occupation evaluation meetings (i.e. ‘Lessons Learnt’) in continuing to improve the Planning process and to ensure that any corrective measures are highlighted and implemented


About Your Experience

Ideally you will possess demonstrated knowledge of the rail network, where you have gained operational and track protection experience and understand the requirements working around rail electrical assets. You will have demonstrated organisational skills and attention detail that have seen you succeed in administering procedural requirements and possess the ability to operate independently whilst adhering to quality, safety, and environmental management systems, processes and relevant legislation.

Additionally, you value the importance of teamwork and of listening, challenging your peers and making a difference. You are confident to bring innovation to the table. You have the agility to engage with a variety of stakeholders at all levels and the ability to manage multiple priorities while remaining focused on excellence. Consultative approaches to providing solutions regarding challenging assignments mixed with exceptional customer service are critical skills youve demonstrated over your career.

About The Opportunity

This is a fantastic opportunity to build on the career you've developed to date and take it to the next level by making a tangible impact that matters.

If what you’ve read resonates with your values, experience and career aspiration then we want to hear from you! Please send your application by 5pm, Wednesday 12 September 2018.

Metro Trains is an equal opportunity employer and embraces diversity. We encourage all interested applicants to apply but please do note only applications with the right to live and work in Australia will be considered for this position.

Seniority Level

Associate

Industry

  • Construction
  • Government Administration
  • Transportation/Trucking/Railroad

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Other
]

Health and Strategy Analyst

Company Name Medibank Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 263 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We are Medibank – an integrated healthcare company providing private health insurance and health solutions to 3.7 million Australians


At Medibank we stand for better health for better lives.

\xa0

About Us

We're passionate about nurturing careers.

\xa0

We support new innovation and thinking, and openly collaborate and share new ideas. We're healthy and active in our lives and wellbeing is encouraged at every level. Our people play an important role in the future of health and healthcare and we believe that working together, we're stronger.


The Opportunity

As our Health and Strategy Analyst within Medibank, you will work closely with the Healthcare and Strategy division to deliver analytical insights and recommendations. You will have the opportunity to work on industry leading projects to help evolve healthcare funding and outcomes. Your ability to build constructive relationships with stakeholders and your strength in critical thinking will help deliver actionable insights to the business. As an achiever with a growth mindset, you have an interest in emerging analytical methods to help improve current processes and help solve problems.

\xa0

Key responsibilities will include:

\xa0

- \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Establishing positive relationships with team and stakeholder by showing awareness of individual needs and perspectives;

- \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Critical thinking to develop hypothesis that will enable data-driven decision making and problem solving;

- \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Developing appropriate models using tools (SAS, SQL, R, Python, Excel) to test business hypothesis and assess impacts; and

- \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Summarising and presenting data outputs and complex ideas in a coherent story including meaningful data visualisations.

\xa0

About You\xa0

To be successful in this role, you will have some economic, statistical or other quantitative analysis experience. Your prior experience programming languages such as SAS, SQL, R, or Python as well as your ability to confidently build rapport and communicate effectively will be essential for this position.

\xa0

You will have a tertiary qualification in analytics/data science, health informatics, public health, maths/stats, commerce/economics or similarly quantitatively oriented discipline. You enjoy working with data and business problems and have an interest in continuing to develop your technical skills.

\xa0

Knowledge and understanding of the Australian health and private health insurance sectors would be desirable but not essential for this position

\xa0\xa0

What We Offer\xa0

In return for your hard work we offer a range of great benefits. Furthermore, we take the health and wellbeing of our employees seriously, offering flexible working conditions and encouraging wellbeing at all levels of life.


Medibank is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.


A Career at Medibank adds up to more. More achievement. More progress. More passion and more innovation for health.


For a career option that will suit you better, click to apply.

\xa0

For a confidential discussion, please email\xa0 Nisha.Gopinath@medibank.com.au.


Please note, if this position attracts a large volume of interest, the closing date for applications may be brought forward. With this in mind, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.

Whist the role has a strong client and service focus, it's also very important that we maintain a culture that's fun, energetic and supportive. \xa0


Reporting to the Corporate Bookkeeping Manager, the Senior Bookkeeper will manage the day to day bookkeeping for a portfolio of clients. Joining a small team of 4 onsite and another 4 offsite, we require a self-starting, team player with a wealth of knowledge and experience and a great attitude.


This client facing role is best suited to a Bookkeeper with strong communication skills and the confidence needed to support both technical and personal requirements of the role.

The Senior Corporate Bookkeeper will also manage an Accounts Assistant who will assist with processing and data entry. \xa0

  • Responsible for implementation of Instrumentation design for projects including all documentation and Manuals -– sizing and selection of different types of instruments (including transmitters, valves, analyzers) for metals and mineral processing applications that include hazardous areas, generation of instrument index, datasheets, mechanical and electrical hookup diagrams , junction box schedules and cable schedules.

  • Responsible for supervision of I & C equipment installations, workshop and site commissioning of I & C equipment.

  • Good communication and presentation skills.
  • Willingness for infrequent, short-term travel.

Job description

Professional Services Consultant (SDN)

This is a highly technical and customer-facing role, providing primarily post-sales Consulting delivery under the Juniper Networks Professional Services (PS) APAC Team. The role covers Architectural, Design and Implementation Consultancy services for Junipers Networks Solutions. The consultant is expected to drive overall customer solution and delivering the solution to meet the customer’s business objectives while managing within the confines of the agreed scope. The consultant is also expected to be able to manage deviations to scope as part of change management and change handling.

Key Duties And Responsibilities Include

This is a technical role in the PS Theater team, reporting directly to the APAC Practice Team Manager. Specific Responsibilities include:
  • Work with Account teams to enable customer consumption of standard PS offers
  • Collaborate with Customers, Sales, Account, and Business Development teams to understand the unique customer use cases and desired outcomes to enable proper positioning of standard PS offers
  • Provide integration of multiple PS offers into solutions for customers
  • Collaborate with the customer on alignment / inclusion of Juniper solutions into Customer’s Enterprise Architecture
  • Consultation and collaboration with multiple (internal and external) parties, including customers, to understand business and technical requirements, in order to provide, develop, deploy and/or integrate a solution
  • Present and deliver solutions via projects; some basic project management by the consultant is required, e.g. scope, effort, time and problem & risk management
  • Subject Matter Expert in one or more Juniper Networks products/solutions
  • Creation or development of marketable and deployable solutions based on Juniper Networks products/solutions
  • Create necessary high quality documentation and/or presentations to share knowledge and experience in areas of expertise, so to increase the overall effectiveness and efficiency of PS
  • Be involved and support Sales and Account Teams at pre-sales and/or resolution of technical issues
  • Utilizes skills and experience to contribute to the development of company objectives and principles and to achieve goals in effective and efficient ways
  • Provide (technical and non-technical) leadership and guidance to more junior consultants or colleagues
  • Travel for projects required; arrangement of own travel (via company travel agent) and visa requirements
  • Prepared to willingly and constantly share knowledge within the team for the betterment and improvement of other team members.

Requirements
  • Has solid experience of large scale solutions projects delivery to Service Provider and/or Enterprise customers.
  • Has experience in the construction and architecture of virtualized solutions such as NFV, SDN controllers and overarching orchestration platforms.
  • SDN/NFV technical skills:

  • Ideal - Contrail, OpenStack, Contrail Service Orchestration, Ubuntu, Hypervisors, Containers, Docker and other Juniper products including vMX, vSRX, NFX. Knowledge of underlay/overlay networking.
  • Essential - Linux, Scripting (e.g. Perl, Python), DC systems installation & integration into OSS/IT
  • Advantageous - VMware vCenter/NSX, MPLSoGRE, VXLAN, RESTful APIs, Icinga, Junos (awareness not expertise), SLAX/Junos Automation, Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Cobbler
  • Good general understanding of Security as an integral part of any solution.
  • Strong JUNOS skills and excellent hands on and planning capabilities with MX Series products, PTX Series, EX Series, E Series, MX BNG
  • Hands on and planning capabilities in TCP/IP, MPLS, Traffic Engineering, IGP, BGP, Internet peering/exchanges
  • Good Experience in Metro Ethernet, Broadband technologies and Seamless MPLS, QoS and IP related services
  • Has experience with complex solutions architectures that involves software development (using APIs) and or modification as a means of completing the solution.
  • Has Professional Services consulting and business consulting experience, including conflict management and hands on delivery experience of technical projects.
  • Demonstrates an excellent understanding of the industry, the customer's business issues, and the most appropriate solution architecture to meet their business goals.
  • Strong Architectural background including plan, design, and implement phases and best practices
  • Able to bridge the business imperatives and supporting technical solutions that enable the business
  • Capable of operating autonomously and with initiative or when required under direction; ability to decide when either is best
  • Capable of prioritization and making timely decisions even in difficult situations and is responsible and accountable for decisions and actions
  • High drive to succeed by direct contribution or when necessary via collaboration and influence; ability to decide when either is best
  • Expert (verbal and written) communication and interpersonal skills; capable of communicating with audience from different levels and diverse backgrounds, and, maintaining relationships even in difficult situations. English is mandatory. All other languages may be an advantage, e.g. Japanese, Mandarin, Hindi.
  • Expert in technical documentation and presentations
  • Expert collaboration and leadership skills; capable leading others through the use of influence, communication, relationship and/or timing
  • Leads development of complex and/or large scale solutions, identifying and leveraging SMEs and the broader team to complete deliverables as necessary.
  • Ensures best practice methods are used for scoping and delivery of new technology and solutions.
  • Closely monitors progress and quality as well as risks and delays.
  • Works on significant and unique issues where analysis of situations or data requires an evaluation of intangibles.
  • Exercises independent judgment in methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for obtaining results that are the most conducive to the customer environment and assignment.
  • Creates informal networks involving coordination among groups and individuals.
  • Mentor junior consultants on customer projects to assist with achieving training and development goals.
    • Supervision
    • Acts independently to determine methods and procedures on new or special assignments.
    • Possibly supervises the activities of other consultants assigned to deliver the solution.

    Experience
    • Typically requires 12-15 years of related experience
    • Bachelors or MS degree in Computer Science or Computer/Electrical Engineering
    • Business related qualifications and product certifications on specific solutions that make up the consultants solutions areas.
    • Expert-level (JNCIE, CCIE) networking certifications are desired as appropriate.

    Other Job Specifications
    • Expert communication and interpersonal skills.
    • Expert collaboration and leadership skills.
    • Expert conflict management skills.

    • Strong industry expertise.

837517466:
[

Senior Learning Consultant

Company Name Spring Point Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 223 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

SENIOR LEARNING CONSULTANT

SPRING POINT.

\xa0

www.springpoint.com.au

\xa0

The future of work is here. To succeed, organisations need their people to learn, unlearn and relearn at rates never seen before. We’re excited to be supporting so many organisations across Australia with this challenge. As a result, we’re growing quickly and have big plans for what comes next. \xa0We’re therefore looking for a Senior Learning Consultant to join our Melbourne team and established Leadership & Learning practice.


What We Need

  • A SEASONED CONSULTANT: We want to get this right and we want this to be right for you. We’re therefore looking for someone with previous experience within a consulting firm. This way, you already know that the pace and rhythm of consulting suits you and from day one, have a honed process and methodology to bring your ideas to life for our client

  • HAPPIEST WHEN YOU ARE THE GO-TO PERSON FOR A CLIENT: You need to have a passion for working closely with clients to do great work. Practically this means being a day-to-day touchpoint, likely on a range of project with a range of clients. We pride ourselves on the relationships we create and nurture with our clients and this role will be critical in partnering with them to create amazing results.

  • YOU’RE A UNIQUE BLEND OF CREATIVITY & EFFICIENT PROJECT DELIVERY: We’re looking for that special blend of person who is equal parts creative flair and organised efficiency. This role will see you splitting your time between designing progressive, memorable learning solutions with program managing the delivery of these solutions within scope and timeframes. This means you know your way around a project plan and are comfortable directing traffic and overcoming roadblocks to achieve it.

  • DESIGN IN YOUR DNA: While this role does require a balance between design and project management, we are looking for someone who seems born to design. This means that you will have a knack for new ways of looking at things and seeing connections where others don’t to find ways to meet unmet needs. You’re also likely to have an eye for visual design to bring learning to life when collaborating with our graphic designers, animators, and developers.

  • SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTISE IN THE SKILL AREAS THAT MAKE US UNIQUELY HUMAN: In a post AI world, the learning we design is typically geared towards the capabilities that set us apart from robots: leadership, communication, empathy, complex reasoning and creative problem solving. You will have therefore worked with content related to these capability areas before and may have even studied Psychology at one point. The flipside is, if you live to write compliance training or mandatory learning modules this gig probably isn’t for you.

  • A LEARNER FROM WAY BACK: Learning is a cultural state of mind that’s central to who we are as a business. We look for members of our team to be open to feedback and coaching others, having a go and always trying to become better. For us, openness to learning is also about owning your decisions (the ones that turn out as well as the ones that don’t), asking for help when you need it and not waiting to be asked when you don’t. As a senior member of our team we’ll expect you to role model these sorts of behaviours.

  • THE USUAL LEARNING STUFF: We need someone who can design overarching learning solutions/journeys/experiences/campaigns (whatever lingo takes your fancy) as well as the instructional design of specific learning assets. Given the multi-faceted (i.e. blended) nature of most our learning projects you will need to be as comfortable designing face-to-face experiences as digital ones. Session planning, storyboarding and scripting for workshops, eLearning, video, animations, podcasts etc. should feel second nature to you.

  • THE EXTRAS: Business development capability (the ability to leverage a strong network, diagnose needs, write winning proposals etc.) while not essential, gets you additional gold stars


What We Offer

  • THE THRILL OF A STARTUP WITH THE SECURITY OF 10 YEAR TRACK RECORD: While our Spring Point brand is new, our team, business operations, IP and client set are not. We’re passionate, hungry and purpose-led but certainly not starting from scratch.

  • THE OPPORTUNITY TO BE PART OF OUR GROWTH STORY: We have a clear strategy and exciting plans to “change the way we work, improve the way we live”. Designing learning solutions that stick and enable our clients’ business strategies and / or cultural aspirations is just the start. By joining us close to the beginning of our story you get to write yourself into it.

  • TRUE FLEXIBILITY: Provided we all deliver excellent client outcomes, we get to pick when, where and how we work. For us, flexibility is a two-way street and if you also appreciate this, nothing’s off the table.

  • THE SPICE OF LIFE: Our clients are many and varied. You get to work across industries and business contexts which keeps things interesting and enables you to continue to develop your commercial acumen. \xa0

  • OPPORTUNITY TO SEE THE WHOLE PICTURE AND HAVE GREATER IMPACT: Our broader consulting in organisational development and effectiveness means that the learning and capability work that you are exposed to is more strategic and systemic than most. You also get the opportunity to get involved in projects focused on a broad range of people practices that enable business strategy and culture change. \xa0

  • A TEAM THAT’S THERE FOR EACH OTHER: We love our work and we love who we get to do it with each day. If being part of a team that really cares about one another is important to you, then the Spring Point team may be an ideal fit.


To apply, send us your CV at hello@springpoint.com.au. We don’t need a cover letter, just your top 3 reasons why you think this is a good fit for you, and why you think you’re a good fit for us.

Applications close 29/09/2018.

Job Description

Electrical WHS Supervisor

The primary responsibilities of this role will be daily management of all WHS administration and reporting to ensure that all actionable responses are completed and documented.

The secondary responsibilities are to provide electrical compliance/maintenance of Television equipment.

Responsibilities will be broad and changeable in nature ranging office work to single and 3 phase electrical works. The time spent will be around 70% WHS management, 30% Electrical trade work.

What You Will Do
  • Daily and weekly management of all WHS administration and reporting to ensure that all actionable responses are completed and documented.

A preventative maintenance focus is required in collaboration with Site managers as well as NEP’s Head Electrician.

  • Advising on and providing a range of financial services to branch customers, which include responding to enquires and opening accounts.
